result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:41 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF605, 15CF1172, 16CF397, 15CF731, AND 15CF821. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty John Bachman.  

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 16CF605. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed. Reading waived. 

OTR: 3:46 pm BOTR: 3:48 pm 

PLEA HEARING IN ALL FILES. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 16CF605: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/Repeater/2nd and subsequent offense)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine/Repeater/2nd and subsequent offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1172: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF397: Ct. 1 (Possession of Electric Weapon/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
In 15CF731: Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/Conspiracy to Commit/Repeater/2nd and subsequent offense)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/Repeater/ 2nd and subsequent)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF821: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CF605: Amended Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/2nd and subsequent offense)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF731: Amended Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/Conspiracy to Commit/2nd and subsequent offense)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: On each: SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, make a good faith effort to obtain fulltime status; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITION of probation on Ct. 1 in 16CF605>> 9 months MCJ with huber for work/schooling/treatment if def qualifies and 10 days jail credit - jail must commence within 45 days of today on a date established by DOC.  
COURT has NO objection to jail being served on EMP but notes that is up to sheriff's dept. 

Atty Bachman requests $250 cash bond in 16CF397 be applied to court costs. 
COURT ORDERS $250 cash bond in 16CF397 returned to surety. 


Adj: 4:07 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for drugs-day report.  No contact with A.W.& A.S. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from illicit substances.
